page.title: 04School Provision (C)
page.content: Primary education is provided in this area for children between the ages of 5 and 11. The LEA policy is to admit children during the school year in which they are 5, either in September or January,depending on their birthday. Extra resources have been provided at a few schools enabling all the children to be admitted in the Autumn term. Parents may choose which school they want for their children,providing that places are available.Each school has an admissions policy outlining priorities when allocating places.Admission to county or controlled schools is the responsibility of the LEA but in Aided schools this rests with the Governing Body.At 11 children from R.C.schools are expected to transfer to Our Lady's High School.Otherwise all children take a selection test for a place at Grammar school or Secondary Modern school.
